knimeNode.name: Database Row Filter (legacy)
knimeNode.shortDescription: The Database Row Filter allows to filter rows from database table.

intro.p: This node is part of the legacy database framework and will be deprecated at the end of 2022. For more information on how to migrate to the new database framework see the migration section of the database documentation.

This node allows rows to be filtered from the input database table while the SQL result will only contain the remaining rows. Within the dialog, an SQL WHERE clause is interactively created by selecting a column, an operator, and a filter value.

fullDescription.option: Contains the columns available in the input table.
With the WHERE clause, the following operators can be used: =, <>, !=, >, <, >=, <=, BETWEEN, LIKE, IN
Enter the specific value to filter on. Quotes ('') need to be added when filtering string columns. A "%" sign can be used to define wildcard pattern.

ports.inPort: Table in database to apply row filter
ports.outPort: Table in the database with filtered rows
